text:
Q: PHP how to get local IP of system A:

Community addition: for the modern and more accurate solution, check this answer below

From CLI

PHP < 5.3.0

$localIP = getHostByName(php_uname('n'));

PHP >= 5.3.0

$localIP = getHostByName(getHostName());

Q: Shape intersection design A:

This is nice ! Thank you. Two things I would improve:

  • Explicit instance of the Intersector class (though writing this I can think of its usefullness: for example, to cache results)
  • Global scope for the intersect function. Here I think I confused everyone in the question: by intersect(A, B) I didn't mean just a function. It is supposed to be a way to intersect two shapes conceptually be it a function or a class with a call operator, or anything you want.

Q: gnuplot input and/or tic number processing/formatting A:

You're asking it to plot two lines: the first column (1:1), and the first against the second (1:2). The first column has values all around 2000, so that's what gets plotted. It leaves the second line way down at the bottom.

Just eliminate that first clause:

plot "data" using 1:2 with lines title ""

Refer above video and try to use github co-pilot, it will create a best folder structure based on need

Q: Lightweight GCC for Alpine A:

There is non official docker image for GCC in dockerhub. If you want to use smaller base builder image.

frolvlad/alpine-gcc

But you can use two stage Dockerimage for this task.

  • First build with standard gcc docker image.
  • Second run in another stage, which use for example alpine which only runs your executable.

By using this method the final docker image which you can run it by create a container based on, have about 8MB size.

This is Dockerfile

FROM gcc:14.2.0 AS builder # Or try alpine-gcc images if you want even smaller build stage
# FROM frolvlad/alpine-gcc AS builder
# https://hub.docker.com/r/frolvlad/alpine-gcc

WORKDIR /app

COPY run.c .

RUN gcc -o myapplication run.c

# Runtime stage: tiny Alpine
FROM alpine:latest

WORKDIR /app

# Copy the binary
COPY --from=builder /app/myapplication .

CMD ["./myapplication"]

Build

docker build -t docker-hello-world-c .

Run

docker run docker-hello-world-c

Image Size

$ docker image ls
docker-hello-world-c   latest    a2de7929897b   4 seconds ago   8.46MB

My other answer to related topic.

  • Execute a C program using Docker windows

Q: Reason behind git lock errors A:

Newer versions of Git (2.30+) come with a maintenance tool that runs gc and packs refs in the background periodically. This keeps the number of "loose" files low automatically.

Run this in your repo:

git maintenance start

Q: Is it possible to add additional information to an already signed executable? If so, what approaches can be used to do this? A:

Of course not. That's the whole POINT of the digital signature -- to ensure that the file remains undamaged.
